meanings.definition: The sail set on the foremost mast of a sailing vessel.
meanings.sent1: The foresail caught the wind and propelled the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The crew hoisted the foresail to catch the breeze.
meanings.sent3: As the foresail billowed, the sailors cheered at the speed.
meanings.sent4: The foresail was a white giant against the blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The foresail fluttered like a bird's wing in the wind.

meanings.definition: The sail set on the foremast of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The foresail was the first to be raised when setting sail.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the crew to trim the foresail for better speed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the foresail, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: The foresail stood tall like a proud flag on the ship.
meanings.sent5: The foresail's fabric gleamed in the sunlight, guiding the vessel.
